title: Finn's Car: a kart racer spies a chance (Finn's Fast Books Book 2)
features: Finn doesn’t always feel like a winner. He fails his driving test. He fails to impress the pretty girl in class. So he’s determined to meet the challenge of his engineering class project. Finn and his friends will build and race a hybrid vehicle for the Monaco Karting Grand Prix.
But at speeds over 60 mph, sabotage and corporate espionage force Finn to ask himself, how far will he go to win?
"I felt like I was hanging out with my best buds while reading Finn's Car. Fifteen-year-old Finn and his friends are that enjoyable, that much fun. My recommendation? Hop aboard!"
, the award-winning middle grade novel by Serena Schreiber. You'll be on the edge of your seat! Get
description: a standalone action story full of fast turns and unexpected twists. Finn meets a girl, Parminder, who is smart and pretty and better than Finn at practically everything. She even likes kart racing, just like Finn. If you're a kid who likes building things, racing, or adventures stories, you'll like Finn!

Kart tires screaming at 60 mph, high school freshman Finn battles to keep up with racing buddy Axel. When he's on the soccer field, Finn outscores best friend Burrito. But chasing after the smart and pretty Parminder, he falls flat.

Finn gets a unique chance to prove himself. He joins the engineering club to design and build the fastest hybrid go-kart in the world. Invited to race the Monaco Grand Prix, but plagued by sabotage and corporate espionage, how far will Finn go to win? And will he get the girl?
Serena Schreiber's work first appeared in a collection of poems by the children of P.S. 312 (Brooklyn, New York 1973). Her debut novel for young people,

won a Royal Palm Literary Award in 2011. The next book in the Finn's Travels Series, 'Finn's Car,' was published in 2013. Coming soon in 2014, Finn's Rocket.When she's not thinking up adventure stories, Serena writes about Climate Change and is an active member of Florida Writers Association (FWA). She co-founded Howl at the Moon Writers Jam in Stuart, Florida for authors and songwriters.Schreiber's short story 'Axel's Wheels' appeared in the anthology 'My Wheels' in 2012. Her short story 'Fin Fatale' was published in the anthology 'It's a Crime' in October 2013.
, strap on your seat belt and leave the driving to Finn. Fast cars (of the go-kart variety), mystery, a touch of romance and Florida-to-Monte-Carlo adventures await!" -Greg Taylor, author of
--This text refers to an out of print or unavailable edition of this title.
